qas.question: What was Mexico home to prior to the arrival of the Spaniards?

answers.text: from between 1200 BCE to about 400 BCE

qas.question: Who held sway in the mountains of Oaxaca?
Where was the Aztec's central capital located?

context: The territory of modern-day Mexico was home to numerous <a0_0>indigenous civilizations<a0_0/> prior to the arrival of the Spanish conquistadores: The Olmecs, who flourished <a1_0>from between 1200 BCE to about 400 BCE<a1_0/> in the coastal regions of the Gulf of Mexico; <a2_0>the Zapotecs and the Mixtecs<a2_0/>, who held sway in the mountains of Oaxaca and the Isthmus of Tehuantepec; <a3_0>the Maya<a3_0/> in the Yucatan (and into neighbouring areas of contemporary Central America); the Purépecha in present-day Michoacán and surrounding areas, and the Aztecs/Mexica, who, from their central capital at <a4_0>Tenochtitlan<a4_0/>, dominated much of the centre and south of the country (and the non-Aztec inhabitants of those areas) when Hernán Cortés first landed at Veracruz.
